verses.verse: And when the people <S%H5971><s%> complained <S%H596><s%>, it displeased <S%H7451><s%> <S%H241><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>: and the LORD <S%H3068><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> it; and his anger <S%H639><s%> was kindled <S%H2734><s%>; and the fire <S%H784><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> burnt <S%H1197><s%> among them, and consumed <S%H398><s%> them that were in the uttermost parts <S%H7097><s%> of the camp <S%H4264><s%>. complained: or, were as it were complainers it displeased: Heb. it was evil in the ears of

And the people <S%H5971><s%> cried <S%H6817><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>; and when Moses <S%H4872><s%> prayed <S%H6419><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, the fire <S%H784><s%> was quenched <S%H8257><s%>. was: Heb. sunk

And he called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of the <S%H1931><s%> place <S%H4725><s%> Taberah <S%H8404><s%>: because the fire <S%H784><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> burnt <S%H1197><s%> among them. Taberah: that is, A burning

And the mixt multitude <S%H628><s%> that was among <S%H7130><s%> them fell a lusting <S%H183><s%> <S%H8378><s%>: and the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> also wept <S%H1058><s%> again <S%H7725><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Who shall give us flesh <S%H1320><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%>? fell: Heb. lusted a lust wept: Heb. returned and wept

We remember <S%H2142><s%> the fish <S%H1710><s%>, which we did eat <S%H398><s%> in Egypt <S%H4714><s%> freely <S%H2600><s%>; the cucumbers <S%H7180><s%>, and the melons <S%H20><s%>, and the leeks <S%H2682><s%>, and the onions <S%H1211><s%>, and the garlick <S%H7762><s%>:
But now our soul <S%H5315><s%> is dried away <S%H3002><s%>: there is nothing at all, beside <S%H1115><s%> this manna <S%H4478><s%>, before our eyes <S%H5869><s%>.

And the manna <S%H4478><s%> was as coriander <S%H1407><s%> seed <S%H2233><s%>, and the colour <S%H5869><s%> thereof as the colour <S%H5869><s%> of bdellium <S%H916><s%>. colour thereof: Heb. eye of it as the eye of

And the people <S%H5971><s%> went about <S%H7751><s%>, and gathered <S%H3950><s%> it, and ground <S%H2912><s%> it in mills <S%H7347><s%>, or beat <S%H1743><s%> it in a mortar <S%H4085><s%>, and baked <S%H1310><s%> it in pans <S%H6517><s%>, and made <S%H6213><s%> cakes <S%H5692><s%> of it: and the taste <S%H2940><s%> of it was as the taste <S%H2940><s%> of fresh <S%H3955><s%> oil <S%H8081><s%>.
And when the dew <S%H2919><s%> fell <S%H3381><s%> upon the camp <S%H4264><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>, the manna <S%H4478><s%> fell <S%H3381><s%> upon it.

Then Moses <S%H4872><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> weep <S%H1058><s%> throughout their families <S%H4940><s%>, every man <S%H376><s%> in the door <S%H6607><s%> of his tent <S%H168><s%>: and the anger <S%H639><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> was kindled <S%H2734><s%> greatly <S%H3966><s%>; Moses <S%H4872><s%> also was displeased <S%H7489><s%> <S%H5869><s%>.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, Wherefore hast thou afflicted <S%H7489><s%> thy servant <S%H5650><s%>? and wherefore have I not found <S%H4672><s%> favour <S%H2580><s%> in thy sight <S%H5869><s%>, that thou layest <S%H7760><s%> the burden <S%H4853><s%> of all this people <S%H5971><s%> upon me?

Have I conceived <S%H2029><s%> all this people <S%H5971><s%>? have I begotten <S%H3205><s%> them, that thou shouldest say <S%H559><s%> unto me, Carry <S%H5375><s%> them in thy bosom <S%H2436><s%>, as a nursing father <S%H539><s%> beareth <S%H5375><s%> the sucking child <S%H3243><s%>, unto the land <S%H127><s%> which thou swarest <S%H7650><s%> unto their fathers <S%H1><s%>?

Whence <S%H370><s%> should I have flesh <S%H1320><s%> to give <S%H5414><s%> unto all this people <S%H5971><s%>? for they weep <S%H1058><s%> unto me, saying <S%H559><s%>, Give <S%H5414><s%> us flesh <S%H1320><s%>, that we may eat <S%H398><s%>.
I am not able <S%H3201><s%> to bear <S%H5375><s%> all this people <S%H5971><s%> alone <S%H905><s%>, because it is too heavy <S%H3515><s%> for me.

And if thou deal <S%H6213><s%> thus with me, kill <S%H2026><s%> me, I pray thee, out of hand <S%H2026><s%>, if I have found <S%H4672><s%> favour <S%H2580><s%> in thy sight <S%H5869><s%>; and let me not see <S%H7200><s%> my wretchedness <S%H7451><s%>.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, Gather <S%H622><s%> unto me seventy <S%H7657><s%> men <S%H376><s%> of the elders <S%H2205><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, whom thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> to be the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%>, and officers <S%H7860><s%> over them; and bring <S%H3947><s%> them unto the tabernacle <S%H168><s%> of the congregation <S%H4150><s%>, that they may stand <S%H3320><s%> there with thee.

And I will come down <S%H3381><s%> and talk <S%H1696><s%> with thee there: and I will take <S%H680><s%> of the spirit <S%H7307><s%> which is upon thee, and will put <S%H7760><s%> it upon them; and they shall bear <S%H5375><s%> the burden <S%H4853><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> with thee, that thou bear <S%H5375><s%> it not thyself alone.

And say <S%H559><s%> thou unto the people <S%H5971><s%>, Sanctify <S%H6942><s%> yourselves against to morrow <S%H4279><s%>, and ye shall eat <S%H398><s%> flesh <S%H1320><s%>: for ye have wept <S%H1058><s%> in the ears <S%H241><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Who shall give us flesh <S%H1320><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%>? for it was well <S%H2895><s%> with us in Egypt <S%H4714><s%>: therefore the LORD <S%H3068><s%> will give <S%H5414><s%> you flesh <S%H1320><s%>, and ye shall eat <S%H398><s%>.

Ye shall not eat <S%H398><s%> one <S%H259><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, nor two days <S%H3117><s%>, nor five <S%H2568><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>, neither ten <S%H6235><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>, nor twenty <S%H6242><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>;

But even a whole month <S%H2320><s%> <S%H3117><s%>, until it come out <S%H3318><s%> at your nostrils <S%H639><s%>, and it be loathsome <S%H2214><s%> unto you: because <S%H3282><s%> that ye have despised <S%H3988><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> which is among <S%H7130><s%> you, and have wept <S%H1058><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him, saying <S%H559><s%>, Why came we forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>? whole: Heb. month of days

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, The people <S%H5971><s%>, among <S%H7130><s%> whom I am, are six <S%H8337><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> footmen <S%H7273><s%>; and thou hast said <S%H559><s%>, I will give <S%H5414><s%> them flesh <S%H1320><s%>, that they may eat <S%H398><s%> a whole <S%H3117><s%> month <S%H2320><s%>.

Shall the flocks <S%H6629><s%> and the herds <S%H1241><s%> be slain <S%H7819><s%> for them, to suffice <S%H4672><s%> them? or shall all the fish <S%H1709><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%> be gathered together <S%H622><s%> for them, to suffice <S%H4672><s%> them?

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, Is the LORD'S <S%H3068><s%> hand <S%H3027><s%> waxed short <S%H7114><s%>? thou shalt see <S%H7200><s%> now whether my word <S%H1697><s%> shall come to pass <S%H7136><s%> unto thee or not.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%>, and told <S%H1696><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and gathered <S%H622><s%> the seventy <S%H7657><s%> men <S%H376><s%> of the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%>, and set <S%H5975><s%> them round about <S%H5439><s%> the tabernacle <S%H168><s%>.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> came down <S%H3381><s%> in a cloud <S%H6051><s%>, and spake <S%H1696><s%> unto him, and took <S%H680><s%> of the spirit <S%H7307><s%> that was upon him, and gave <S%H5414><s%> it unto the seventy <S%H7657><s%> elders <S%H2205><s%> <S%H376><s%>: and it came to pass, that, when the spirit <S%H7307><s%> rested <S%H5117><s%> upon them, they prophesied <S%H5012><s%>, and did not cease <S%H3254><s%>.

But there remained <S%H7604><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> of the men <S%H582><s%> in the camp <S%H4264><s%>, the name <S%H8034><s%> of the one <S%H259><s%> was Eldad <S%H419><s%>, and the name <S%H8034><s%> of the other <S%H8145><s%> Medad <S%H4312><s%>: and the spirit <S%H7307><s%> rested <S%H5117><s%> upon them; and they were of them that were written <S%H3789><s%>, but went not out <S%H3318><s%> unto the tabernacle <S%H168><s%>: and they prophesied <S%H5012><s%> in the camp <S%H4264><s%>.

And there ran <S%H7323><s%> a young man <S%H5288><s%>, and told <S%H5046><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Eldad <S%H419><s%> and Medad <S%H4312><s%> do prophesy <S%H5012><s%> in the camp <S%H4264><s%>.

And Joshua <S%H3091><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Nun <S%H5126><s%>, the servant <S%H8334><s%> of Moses <S%H4872><s%>, one of his young men <S%H979><s%>, answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%>, My lord <S%H113><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%>, forbid <S%H3607><s%> them.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him, Enviest <S%H7065><s%> thou for my sake? would God that all the <S%H5414><s%> LORD'S <S%H3068><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> were prophets <S%H5030><s%>, and that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> would put <S%H5414><s%> his spirit <S%H7307><s%> upon them!
And Moses <S%H4872><s%> gat <S%H622><s%> him into the camp <S%H4264><s%>, he and the elders <S%H2205><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

And there went forth <S%H5265><s%> a wind <S%H7307><s%> from the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and brought <S%H1468><s%> quails <S%H7958><s%> from the sea <S%H3220><s%>, and let them fall <S%H5203><s%> by the camp <S%H4264><s%>, as it were a day's <S%H3117><s%> journey <S%H1870><s%> on this side <S%H3541><s%>, and as it were a day's <S%H3117><s%> journey <S%H1870><s%> on the other side <S%H3541><s%>, round about <S%H5439><s%> the camp <S%H4264><s%>, and as it were two cubits <S%H520><s%> high upon the face <S%H6440><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>. as it were a day's: Heb. as it were the way of a day

And the people <S%H5971><s%> stood up <S%H6965><s%> all that day <S%H3117><s%>, and all that night <S%H3915><s%>, and all the next <S%H4283><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, and they gathered <S%H622><s%> the quails <S%H7958><s%>: he that gathered least <S%H4591><s%> gathered <S%H622><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> homers <S%H2563><s%>: and they spread <S%H7849><s%> them all abroad <S%H7849><s%> for themselves round about <S%H5439><s%> the camp <S%H4264><s%>.

And while the flesh <S%H1320><s%> was yet <S%H2962><s%> between their teeth <S%H8127><s%>, ere it was chewed <S%H3772><s%>, the wrath <S%H639><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> was kindled <S%H2734><s%> against the people <S%H5971><s%>, and the LORD <S%H3068><s%> smote <S%H5221><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> with a very <S%H3966><s%> great <S%H7227><s%> plague <S%H4347><s%>.

And he called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of that place <S%H4725><s%> Kibrothhattaavah <S%H6914><s%>: because there they buried <S%H6912><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> that lusted <S%H183><s%>. Kibrothhattaavah: that is, The graves of lust
And the people <S%H5971><s%> journeyed <S%H5265><s%> from Kibrothhattaavah <S%H6914><s%> unto Hazeroth <S%H2698><s%>; and abode at Hazeroth <S%H2698><s%>. abode at: Heb. they were in
